security: Revealing operational details about AMLASH/1, including his Cuban asset status, contact with LNERGO, and planned debriefing, could endanger current and future intelligence operations. The cable explicitly mentions "CUBAN ASSET 1903-1965", which highlights his previous association and might compromise his current status. Further, disclosing internal tracking mechanisms such as "FILE: 201-252234. CADL RV% 2 JAN 2000 DRV D9C.3" could assist adversaries in identifying and exploiting CIA record-keeping procedures.
summary: A cable regarding AMLASH/1's arrival in Madrid, his contact with LNERGO, and plans for a debriefing to determine his future plans; also, AMLASH/1 has refused to grant interviews to numerous media representatives since arriving in Madrid.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret cable dated January 22, 1980, concerns AMLASH/1 (Cuban asset, IDEN A), who arrived in Madrid on December 11, 1979, and contacted a LNERGO source in the U.S. requesting a meeting with a REACTION representative. AMLASH/1 has been approached by numerous media representatives since his arrival but has declined to be interviewed. IDEN B is scheduled to depart on January 7, 1980, for Madrid to debrief AMLASH/1 and ascertain his future plans, and LNERGO has been asked to provide bona fides and contact instructions. The cable requests the name and telephone number IDEN B can use to contact the station upon arrival in Madrid, referencing file 201-252234.
title: NINTEL ANLASH
